IPublisher interface

A publisher takes log messages from a Logger and exports them. It might for example, write them to the Flash IDE output window or write them to a file, or send them to a network logging service, or forward them to an OS log, or whatever.

Author

Ralf Siegel

Method summary for the IPublisher interface

MethodDescription
IPublisher.getFilter()Get the current filter for this Publisher.
IPublisher.getFormatter()Gets the formatter currently associated with this publisher
IPublisher.getLevel()Get the log level specifying which messages will be logged by this Publisher. Message levels lower than this level will be discarded.
IPublisher.isLoggable()Check if this Publisher would actually log a given LogRecord. This method checks if the LogRecord has an appropriate Level and whether it satisfies any Filter. It also may make other Publisher specific checks that might prevent a publisher from logging the LogRecord.
IPublisher.publish()Publish a LogRecord. The logging request was made initially to a Logger object, which initialized the LogRecord and forwarded it here. The Handler is responsible for formatting the message.
IPublisher.setFilter()Set a filter to control output on this Publisher. For each call of publish the Publisher will call this Filter (if it is non-null) to check if the LogRecord should be published or discarded.
IPublisher.setFormatter()Set a formatter for this publisher
IPublisher.setLevel()Set the log level specifying which message levels will be logged by this Publisher. Message levels lower than this value will be discarded.
